benefits.title: Effect of magnesium supplementation on insulin resistance in humans: A systematic review.
benefits.summary: Magnesium supplementation reduces insulin resistance in patients with hypomagnesemia presenting insulin resistance.

benefits.title: A Magtein®, Magnesium L-Threonate, -Based Formula Improves Brain Cognitive Functions in Healthy Chinese Adults
benefits.summary: Magnesium L-threonate supplementation, like Magtein®PS, significantly improves memory and cognition in healthy Chinese adults.

benefits.title: Magnesium. An update on physiological, clinical and analytical aspects.
benefits.summary: Magnesium supplementation or intravenous infusion may be beneficial in various diseased states, including alcoholism, eclampsia, hypertension, atherosclerosis, cardiac diseases, diabetes, and asthma.
benefits.journal: Clinica chimica acta; international journal of clinical chemistry

benefits.title: Magnesium in man: implications for health and disease.
benefits.summary: Magnesium supplementation has been beneficial in treating preeclampsia, migraine, depression, coronary artery disease, and asthma.

benefits.title: Role of magnesium in insulin action, diabetes and cardio-metabolic syndrome X.
benefits.summary: Daily magnesium administration improves insulin-mediated glucose uptake in noninsulin-dependent diabetes mellitus patients.

benefits.title: Magnesium—Essentials for Anesthesiologists
benefits.summary: Magnesium benefits include reducing eclampsia and torsades de pointes arrhythmias, having antinociceptive, anesthetic, and neuroprotective effects.

benefits.title: Role of dietary magnesium in cardiovascular disease prevention, insulin sensitivity and diabetes
benefits.summary: Increased dietary magnesium intake confers protection against diabetes, metabolic syndrome, hypertension, and cardiovascular disease, ameliorates insulin resistance, and lowers inflammation.

benefits.title: Magnesium in disease
benefits.summary: Magnesium supplementation appears to prevent high blood pressure and lower the risk of developing a metabolic syndrome.

benefits.title: Magnesium and Cardiovascular Disease.
benefits.summary: Magnesium plays a key role in maintaining normal cellular physiology and metabolism, regulating ion channels and energy generation, and potentially influencing the pathogenesis of cardiovascular disease.

benefits.title: Can Maintaining Optimal Magnesium Balance Reduce the Disease Severity of COVID-19 Patients?
benefits.summary: Magnesium may have significant benefits in reducing the severity of COVID-19 symptoms and potentially reduce the intensity of the infection by potentiating vitamin D functions.

side effects.title: Experimental and clinical evidence of differential effects of magnesium sulfate on neuroprotection and angiogenesis in the fetal brain
side effects.summary: Magnesium sulfate has dose-dependent vascular effects on the fetal brain, causing brain hypoperfusion, stabilization of Hif-1Î±, and impaired endothelial viability.

side effects.title: An interesting case of osteomalacia due to antacid use associated with stainable bone aluminum in a patient with normal renal function.
side effects.summary: Long-term antacid therapy containing aluminum and magnesium hydroxide can lead to severe phosphate depletion, osteomalacia, and toxic accumulation of aluminum and magnesium.

side effects.title: [Use of magnesium sulfate as an anticonvulsant in severe pregnancy toxemia and eclampsia].
side effects.summary: Magnesium sulfate can cause short-term flushing, nausea, and vomiting, and may cause short-acting drops in blood pressure.

side effects.title: Über die Anwendung von Magnesiumsulfat als Antikonvulsivum bei schwerer Schwangerschaftsgestose und Eklampsie
side effects.summary: Magnesium sulphate treatment in pregnancy has a negligible side effect rate, with side effects ranging from short-term flushing, nausea, and vomiting to severe toxic signs.

side effects.title: Effects of dietary sodium and magnesium on cyclosporin A-induced hypertension and nephrotoxicity in spontaneously hypertensive rats.
side effects.summary: Magnesium supplementation (Mg 0.6%) protected against cyclosporin A-induced hypertension and nephrotoxicity during a high-sodium diet.

side effects.title: Magnesium for treatment of asthma in children.
side effects.summary: Magnesium is safe for children, but may cause minor side effects like epigastric or facial warmth, flushing, pain and numbness at the infusion site, dry mouth, malaise, and hypotension.
side effects.journal: Canadian family physician Medecin de famille canadien

side effects.title: Magnesium in obstetrics.
side effects.summary: Side effects of magnesium therapy are generally mild, but the major hazard is neuromuscular weakness.
side effects.journal: Best practice & research. Clinical obstetrics & gynaecology

side effects.title: Speculations on hormonal controls of magnesium homeostasis: a hypothesis.
side effects.summary: Magnesium deficiency may cause hypomagnesemia, hypocalcemia, and decreased intracellular potassium, but taurine may counteract these side effects by stabilizing membranes and binding calcium.

side effects.title: [Drug-induced magnesium deficiency].
side effects.summary: Drugs can induce hypomagnesemia as a side effect, and magnesium deficiency may be a risk factor for torsades-de-pointes tachycardias.

side effects.title: [Effect of antacids on mineral metabolism].
side effects.summary: Magnesium containing antacids may cause metabolic alkalosis, alkaliuria, urinary pH elevation, renal stone formation, and toxic serum concentrations in patients with renal insufficiency.

dosage.title: Effectively Prescribing Oral Magnesium Therapy for Hypertension: A Categorized Systematic Review of 49 Clinical Trials
dosage.summary: Oral magnesium (240 mg/day) safely lowers blood pressure in uncontrolled hypertensive patients taking antihypertensive medications, while >600 mg/day is required to safely lower blood pressure in untreated hypertensives.

dosage.title: The effects of magnesium therapy on the duration of labor.
dosage.summary: Intravenous magnesium administration (7 to 8 mEq. per liter) can best achieve effective blood levels and prolong labor duration in pre-eclamptic and eclamptic patients.
dosage.journal: American journal of obstetrics and gynecology

dosage.title: Magnesium therapy after aneurysmal subarachnoid haemorrhage a dose-finding study for long term treatment
dosage.summary: A continuous intravenous dosage of 64 mmol/L per day maintains serum magnesium levels within the range of 1.0–2.0 mmol/L for 14 days.

dosage.title: Hemodynamic and electrocardiographic effects of magnesium sulfate in healthy dogs.
dosage.summary: A cumulative infusion dosage of 0.1-0.2 mEq/kg of magnesium may be given without changing hemodynamic parameters, but with higher dosages heart rate accelerates and blood pressure increases.

dosage.title: Familial Hypomagnesemia—A Follow-Up Examination of Three Patients After 9 to 12 Years of Treatment
dosage.summary: Optimal dosage for magnesium in this study was found to be 0.5 to 0.75 mmoles/kg/day.

dosage.title: Magnesium moderately decreases remifentanil dosage required for pain management after cardiac surgery.
dosage.summary: Magnesium gluconate was administered as an i.v. bolus of 0.21 mmol kg(-1) followed by a continuous infusion of 0.03 mmol(-1) kg(-1) h(-1) for 12 hours after tracheal extubation.

dosage.title: Effect of transdermal magnesium cream on serum and urinary magnesium levels in humans: A pilot study
dosage.summary: Transdermal delivery of 56 mg Mg/day showed a larger percentage rise in both serum and urinary markers from pre to post intervention compared with subjects using the placebo cream.

dosage.title: The Effects of High Level Magnesium Dialysis/Substitution Fluid on Magnesium Homeostasis under Regional Citrate Anticoagulation in Critically Ill
dosage.summary: High level magnesium fluid with 1.50 mmol/l provided even balances and adequate levels within ordinary configurations of CRRT with RCA without a need for extra magnesium replenishment.

dosage.title: Importance of Health literacy in magnesium supplementation - Case study Novi Sad, Serbia
dosage.summary: Magnesium dietary supplements have dosages ranging from 150 to 400mg, and patients' choices often don't coincide with health authorities' recommendations.

dosage.title: THERAPY OF MAGNESIUM DEFICIENCY *
dosage.summary: Daily addition of 8 to 16 mEq (1 to 2 grams) of magnesium sulfate to intravenous fluids can prevent magnesium deficiency in hospitalized patients.
dosage.journal: Annals of the New York Academy of Sciences
